intro: Wahlbergella tristis, commonly known as the Cape fumitory, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it blooms during the warmer months of the year. Wahlbergella tristis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
